intro: Uragoga nicobarica, commonly known as the Nicobar betel vine, is a climbing plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
